refnamediv.refpurpose: remove unused parts from the data specification of an LPS

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The &lpsdataelm; tool removes unused parts from the data specification from a linear process specification (LPS). It reads the LPS from &infile; and writes the result to &outfile;. If &outfile; is not present, &cstdout; is used. If &infile; is not present, &cstdin; is used.

Unused parts are sorts, constructors, mappings and data equations that do not take part in the behavioural description of the LPS. Removal of these parts makes the LPS more compact, which has the following advantages:
The speed of initialisation of the rewriters increases significantly, in particular the compilation time of the compiling rewriters. Note that data elimination is performed automatically when using the tool &lps2lts-lnk;.
When pretty printing the LPS using &lpspp-lnk;, the resulting specification is smaller.

listitem.para: also remove standard data sorts and functions if unused; by default basic sorts like &sort_bool; and &sort_pos; and functions &func_eq;, &func_neq; and &func_if; are not removed as they may be needed by certain tools
